subject: Relationships
title: Troubadours: The First Songwriters of Love
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Troubadours: The First Songwriters of Love.

hook.text: In 12th-century France, traveling poets invented love songs. Before them, no one sang about romantic feelings.

buildup.text: Troubadours composed in Occitan, creating new words for emotions that had no names yet.

discovery.text: Their songs spread courtly love across Europe. Within a century, love poetry became a cultural obsession.

twist.text: Most troubadours were not nobles. They were commoners who gained status by singing about noble desires.

climax.text: Pop music, love ballads, even breakup playlists â€” all trace back to those wandering medieval poets.

punchline.text: Every love song you've heard started with a medieval poet.

quiz.question: What did troubadours invent?
options: Love songs and romantic poetry in song form
